html.p: What: Create/extract new fields from existing data using regular expressions, or replace/substitute charactesr using SED mode expressions.

ol.li: Don't confuse with the command regex which *filters* events.
Can pull multiple new fields from a single rex call.

html.p: How: | rex field=foo (bunch of regular expression stuff)
Why: Sometimes your data isn't fully extracted, so this command can help with that.
So What: Incredibly useful, often you'll end up creating a proper props.conf EXTRACT out of what you build here. Not always, but often.
Also there's a few more flags you can use that can be useful. See the docs.
As awesome as Splunk is, regex101.com is the bees knees for quickly and visually testing out regex expressions on small data sets.
Check out Clara and Cary's BORE: Boss Of Regular Expressions (PLA1127C) competition workshop this year!

The data we are using for this command: | makeresults format=csv data="_raw activity=yelling loudly; account=12345678-1234; extra information=this is a terrible log format;" We needed a "better example" data set to work with for this.

panel.title: Original Data
panel.html: Let's pretend your logs are terrible, like these are.

search.query: | makeresults format=csv data="_raw activity=yelling loudly; account=12345678-1234; extra information=this is a terrible log format;"

panel.title: Single Field Extract
panel.html: Using | rex "activity=(?<extracted_activity>[^;]*)" we'll extract a new field, "extracted_activity", by including any characters up to the first semicolon after 'activity='.

search.query: | makeresults format=csv data="_raw activity=yelling loudly; account=12345678-1234; extra information=this is a terrible log format;" | rex "activity=(?<extracted_activity>[^;]*)"

panel.title: Multiple Field Extract
panel.html: Using | rex "activity=(?<extracted_activity>.*); account=(?<acct_num>.*); extra information=(?<everything_else>.*);" we'll extract all the fields in the event.

search.query: | makeresults format=csv data="_raw activity=yelling loudly; account=12345678-1234; extra information=this is a terrible log format;" | rex "activity=(?<extracted_activity>.*); account=(?<acct_num>.*); extra information=(?<everything_else>.*);"

panel.title: Sed mode for obfuscation
panel.html: Using | rex mode=sed "s/(\d{8})-\d{4}/XXXXXXXX-YYYY/g" we'll obfuscate sensitive information.

search.query: | makeresults format=csv data="_raw activity=yelling loudly; account=12345678-1234; extra information=this is a terrible log format;" | rex mode=sed "s/(\d{8})-\d{4}/XXXXXXXX-YYYY/g"
